text: SENTETG NG I ETTT I T Typically, when two Pals breed, the resulting Pal is determined by the two parents breeding "Rank". Roughly, the resulting Pal will be the species with the average of the two parents breeding rank. Specifically, the child rank is calculated as follows: ; ParentA_Rank + ParentB_Rank + 1 Child_Rank = {% And then the (eligible) child species with the rank nearest to this value is selected. If two species are equidistant from this value, the first one checked (having the lower "Check Order") is selected.
